brief_description: To measure total and specific antibody titers and T cell responses in a sample of subjects who experienced eczema vaccinatum (EV) and a group of subjects who did not suffer from EV (normal controls or healthy AD subjects).
brief_title: ADVN Biomarker Registry Study: CMI/Ab-Vaccinia Substudy
description: To measure total and specific antibody titers and T cell responses in a sample of subjects who experienced eczema vaccinatum (EV) and a group of subjects who did not suffer from EV (normal controls or healthy AD subjects).
endpoints:
1. Total antibodies (ELISA)
  2. Total vaccinia-specific antibodies (ELISA)
  3. Neutralizing antiviral serum vaccinia-specific antibodies (plaque reduction assay)
  4. Vaccinia-specific memory B-cells (limiting dilution analysis)
  5. IFNγ production by vaccinia-specific CD4+ T cells
  6. IFNγ production by vaccinia-specific CD8+ T cells
  7. IFNγ production by vaccinia-specific NK T cells
  8. CD3 cytokine responses from Memory T cells (Pos Control)
  9. Antigen specific antibody levels: diphtheria
  10. Antigen specific antibody levels: tetanus
  11. Antigen specific antibody levels: pertussis
  12. Antigen specific antibody levels: measles
  13. Antigen specific antibody levels: mumps
  14. Antigen specific antibody levels: rubella
  15. Antigen specific antibody levels: polio
  16. Antigen specific antibody levels: varicella
  17. Antigen specific antibody levels: Epstein-Barr
  18. Antigen specific antibody levels: cytomegalovirus
  19. Total IgE
hypothesis: EV patients have a deficit in their virus-specific antibody or T cell responses following smallpox vaccination and this will be apparent when compared to age/sex-matched subjects who did not experience a severe adverse event following smallpox vaccination.
objectives: To measure Vaccinia antibody titers and T cell responses in subjects who experienced EV and a group of subjects who did not suffer from EV (NA controls or AD subjects).
official_title: ADVN Biomarker Registry Study: CMI/Ab-Vaccinia Substudy
